ai.question: What is one advantage of link-state protocols over most distance-vector protocols?

choice.text: continual route checking with periodic updates

ai.question: Why do link-state protocols converge faster than most distance vector protocols?

choice.text: Distance vector protocols compute their routing tables before sending any routing update, link-state protocols do not.
Link-state protocols have lower computing requirements than distance vector protocols.
Link-state protocols send updates out more often than distance vector protocols.
Distance vector protocols receive more packets per update than link-state protocols.
